==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=3|rs=干05}}

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[ぎょう]] (gyō), {{qualifier|historical}} [[ぎやう]] (gyau)
|kanon=[[こう]] (kō), {{qualifier|historical}} [[かう]]
|kun=[[しあわせ]] (shiawase) > [[しあはせ]] (shiahase), [[さいわい]] (saiwai) > [[さいはひ]] (saihahi), [[さきわい]] (sakiwai) > [[さきはひ]] (sakihahi), [[さき]] (saki), [[さちわい]] (sachiwai) > [[さちはひ]] (sachihahi), [[さち]] (sachi), [[さつ]] (satsu)
|nanori=[[ゆき]] (yuki), [[よし]] (yoshi)
}}

====Compounds====
* [[射幸心]]
* [[薄幸]]

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|こう}}
{{IPAchar|/kau/}} → {{IPAchar|/kɔː/}} → {{IPAchar|/koː/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=こう}} {{m|zh|幸|tr=hɛng<sup>X</sup>|lit=lucky, fortunate, auspicious}}. The [[漢音#Japanese|''kan'on'']], so a later borrowing.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kan|こう|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|こう}}

# good [[luck]], good [[fortune]]; [[happiness]]
# an [[appearance]] by the [[emperor]] or a [[retired]] emperor

=====Usage notes=====
The ''good fortune'' and ''happiness'' senses are generally considered as overlapping.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|good fortune}} {{ja-r|幸福|こうふく}}; {{ja-r|幸い|さいわい}}; {{ja-r|幸|さち}}
* {{sense|happiness}} {{ja-l|仕合せ}}, {{ja-l|幸せ|しあわせ|shiawase}}
* {{sense|imperial appearance}} {{ja-l|行幸}}, {{ja-l|御行}}, {{ja-l|御幸|みゆき|miyuki}}; {{ja-r|御幸|ごこう}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|しあわせ}}
The {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{ja-l|為合わす}}, {{m|ja|仕合わす|tr=shiawasu|pos=lower bigrade, with continuative form ending in ''-e''||to put together well; to work together well}}, itself a compound of {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=しあわせ}} verbs {{m|ja|為|tr=su||to do, to make something be a certain way}} + {{m|ja|合わす|tr=awasu||to join together, to fit together}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

Often spelled {{ja-l|幸せ}} with the final {{ja-l|せ}} to indicate the reading.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|しあわせ|yomi=k|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|幸せ}}, {{ja-l|仕合せ}}, {{ja-l|仕合わせ}}, {{ja-l|倖せ}}

====Adjective====
{{ja-adj|infl=na|しあわせ|hhira=しあはせ}}

# [[happy]]
# [[fortunate]], [[lucky]]

=====Conjugation=====
{{ja-na|しあわせ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しあわせ|hhira=しあはせ}}

# a [[moment]] when [[circumstances]] come together: [[fate]], [[opportunity]] {{qualifier|used to indicate both good and bad instances}}
# [[happiness]]
# good [[fortune]], good [[luck]]
# [[circumstances]], the flow of [[event]]s

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|fate}} {{ja-r|運命|うんめい}}
* {{sense|opportunity}} {{ja-r|機会|きかい}}
* {{sense|happiness}} {{ja-r|幸福|こうふく}}
* {{sense|good fortune}} {{ja-r|幸い|さいわい}}, {{ja-r|幸運|こう.うん}}
* {{sense|circumstances}} {{ja-r|経緯|いきさつ}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|さいわい}}
{{IPAchar|/sakipapi/}} → {{IPAchar|/sakiɸaɸi/}} → {{IPAchar|/sakiwahi/}} → {{IPAchar|/sakiwai/}} → {{IPAchar|/saiwai/}}

Derived from ''sakiwai'' below.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

More often spelled as {{ja-l|幸い}} with the final {{ja-l|い}} to indicate the reading.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|さいわい|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|幸い}}

====Adjective====
{{ja-adj|infl=na|さいわい|hhira=さいはひ}}

# very [[fortunate]] and [[happy]], especially as [[bestow]]ed by [[god]]s, [[spirit]]s, [[buddha]]s, or other entities
# [[favorable]], [[ideal]] {{qualifier|often used in polite constructions}}
#: {{ja-usex|お返事をいただければ'''幸い'''です。|^おへんじ を いただければ '''さいわい''' です。|It would be '''favorable''' if I could have your reply. → I would greatly appreciate your reply.}}

=====Conjugation=====
{{ja-na|さいわい}}

====Adverb====
{{ja-pos|adv|さいわい|hhira=さいはひ}}

# [[fortunately]], [[luckily]], [[happily]]
#: {{ja-usex|'''幸'''、怪我はなかった。|^'''さいわい'''、 けが は なかった。|'''Luckily''', no one was hurt.}}

=====Usage notes=====
When used as an adverb without a particle, this term usually comes at the start of the sentence. It also appears used with advervial particles {{ja-r|に}} and {{ja-r|と}}, or, perhaps more commonly, in an adverbial construction as {{lang|ja|幸なことに}}.

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|さいわい|hhira=さいはひ}}

# very good [[fortune]] and [[happiness]], especially as [[bestow]]ed by [[god]]s, [[spirit]]s, [[buddha]]s, or other entities
# an occurrence of good [[luck]] or good [[fortune]]
# {{qualifier|derivation unknown}} the [[tail]] and back [[fin]]s of a [[carp]] or other fish, as used in [[cooking]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|favorable occurrence}} {{ja-r|幸せ|しあわせ}}
* {{sense|happiness}} {{ja-r|幸せ|しあわせ}}, {{ja-r|幸福|こうふく}}
* {{sense|fish tail and back fins}} {{ja-r|尾鰭|おひれ}}

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|さきわい}}
<span id="sakiwai"></span>{{IPAchar|/sakipapi/}} → {{IPAchar|/sakiɸaɸi/}} → {{IPAchar|/sakiwahi/}} → {{IPAchar|/sakiwai/}}

The {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|幸う|tr=sakiwau||to meet with good fortune; to prosper}}, itself a compound of {{lang|ja|幸}} (''saki'' below, “good fortune, happiness”) + {{ja-l|這う}}, {{m|ja|延う|tr=hau||to spread out widely}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|さきわい}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|幸い}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|さきわい|hhira=さきはひ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=さきわい|obsolete}} an occurrence of good [[luck]] or good [[fortune]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=さきわい|obsolete}} good [[luck]] or good [[fortune]] itself

=====Usage notes=====
Obsolete in modern Japanese, replaced by ''saiwai'' above.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|good fortune}} {{ja-r|幸福|こうふく}}; {{ja-r|幸い|さいわい}}; {{ja-r|幸|さち}}

===Etymology 5===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|さき}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=さき}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Possibly cognate with {{m|ja|先|tr=saki||tip, point; future, ahead}} from the idea of ''[favorable] future''. Possibly also related to ''sachi'' / ''satsu'' below.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|さき}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|さき}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=さき|obsolete}} good [[luck]], good [[fortune]]; [[happiness]]
#: {{RQ:Man'yōshū|18|4095}}
#:: {{lang|ja|大夫能 許己呂於毛保由 於保伎美能 美許登'''佐吉'''乎 聞者多布刀美}}
#::: {{lang|ja|大夫の 心思ほゆ 大君の 御言の'''幸'''を 聞けば貴み}}
#::: {{lang|ja|ますらをの こころおもほゆ おほきみの みことの'''さき'''を きけばたふとみ}}
#::: ''Masurawo no | kokoro omohoyu | Ohokimi no | mikoto no '''saki''' wo | kikeba tafutomi''
#:::: “Such manliness of spirit is brought to mind. How noble to hear of the '''happiness''' / '''good fortune''' of the words of the emperor...”

=====Usage notes=====
The ''good fortune'' and ''happiness'' senses are generally considered as overlapping.

''Saki'' in this sense appears to be obsolete in modern Japanese.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|good fortune}} {{ja-r|幸福|こうふく}}; {{ja-r|幸い|さいわい}}; {{ja-r|幸|さち}}

===Etymology 6===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|さちわい}}
{{IPAchar|/sat͡ɕipapi/}} → {{IPAchar|/sat͡ɕiɸaɸi/}} → {{IPAchar|/sat͡ɕiwahi/}} → {{IPAchar|/sat͡ɕiwai/}}

The {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|幸う|tr=sachiwau||to meet with good fortune; to prosper}}, itself a compound of {{lang|ja|幸}} (''sachi'' below, “good fortune, happiness”) + {{ja-l|這う}}, {{m|ja|延う|tr=hau||to spread out widely}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|さちわい}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|幸い}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|さちわい|hhira=さちはひ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=さちわい|obsolete|rare}} an occurrence of good [[luck]] or good [[fortune]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=さちわい|obsolete|rare}} good [[luck]] or good [[fortune]] itself

=====Usage notes=====
Obsolete in modern Japanese, replaced by ''saiwai'' above. In historical Japanese, ''sachiwai'' appears to be a rarer variant of ''sakiwai'' above.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|good fortune}} {{ja-r|幸福|こうふく}}; {{ja-r|幸い|さいわい}}; {{ja-r|幸|さち}}

===Etymology 7===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|さち}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=さち}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Possibly cognate with {{etyl|ko|-}} {{ko-inline|살||arrow}}. Possibly also related with ''saki'' above.

The kanji may have originally been applied to this word for the source Chinese term's associations with good fortune.

This is the [[standalone]] form of ''satsu'' below. Possibly derived as the fusion of ''satsu'' and {{etyl|ojp|-}} emphatic nominalizing particle {{m|ja|い}}: *{{IPAchar|/satu i/}} → {{IPAchar|/sati/}} → {{IPAchar|/sat͡ɕi/}}

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|さち|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Adjective====
{{ja-adj|infl=na|さち}}

# very [[fortunate]] and [[happy]]

=====Conjugation=====
{{ja-na|さち}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|さち}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=さち|archaic}} a [[hunting]] [[implement]]; the [[spirit]] of a hunting implement
# a [[bounteous]] [[catch]] {{qualifier|for fishing}}, [[amply]] caught [[game]] {{qualifier|for hunting}}; [[food]] {{qualifier|specifically animal protein caught in the wild: [[fish]] or [[game]]}}
# good [[fortune]], good [[luck]]; [[happiness]]

===Etymology 8===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|さつ}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=さつ}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Possibly cognate with {{etyl|ko|-}} {{ko-inline|살||arrow}}. Possibly also related with ''saki'' above.

The kanji may have originally been applied to this word for the source Chinese term's associations with good fortune.

This is the [[bound]] form of ''sachi'' above. This form is only ever used in compounds. Possibly the original form.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|さつ}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|猟}}

====Prefix====
{{ja-pos|prefix|さつ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=さつ|obsolete}} [[hunting]], for [[hunting]]
#: {{ja-usex|'''幸'''矢、'''幸'''弓、'''幸'''人|'''さつ'''や、'''さつ'''ゆみ、'''さつ'''ひと|a '''hunting''' arrow, a '''hunting''' bow, a '''hunt'''er}}
